```{r} 
#Importing Data Set
ss14pusa = read.csv(file.choose(),header=TRUE)  # read csv file
ss14pusb = read.csv(file.choose(),header=TRUE)

```

```{r}
attach(ss14pusa)
names(ss14pusa)
ss14pusa_edit = data.frame(SEX,OCCP,WKHP,MAR,WAGP,SCHL,ESP, RAC1P, REGION)
detach(ss14pusa)

attach(ss14pusb)
ss14pusb_edit = data.frame(SEX,OCCP,WKHP,MAR,WAGP,SCHL,ESP, RAC1P, REGION)
detach(ss14pusb)

Data = rbind(ss14pusa_edit,ss14pusb_edit)
colnames(Data) <- c("Gender","Occupation", "Work_hours", "Marriage", "Income", "Education" "Parental_Occupation", "Race", "Region")

write.csv(Data, file = "Data.csv",row.names=TRUE)
```


```{r, echo = FALSE}
#recode OCCP

Data$OCCP <- ifelse(Data$OCCP >= 10 & Data$OCCP <= 430, 1, Data$OCCP)
Data$OCCP <- ifelse(Data$OCCP >= 1005 & Data$OCCP <= 1240, 2, Data$OCCP)
Data$OCCP <- ifelse(Data$OCCP >= 800 & Data$OCCP <= 950, 3, Data$OCCP)
Data$OCCP <- ifelse(Data$OCCP >= 2105 & Data$OCCP <= 2160, 4, Data$OCCP)
Data$OCCP <- ifelse(Data$OCCP >= 3000 & Data$OCCP <= 3540, 5, Data$OCCP)
Data$OCCP <- ifelse(Data$OCCP >= 510 & Data$OCCP <= 740, 6, Data$OCCP)
Data$OCCP <- ifelse(Data$OCCP >= 1300 & Data$OCCP <= 1560, 7, Data$OCCP)
Data$OCCP <- ifelse(Data$OCCP >= 1600 & Data$OCCP <= 1965, 8, Data$OCCP)

Data <- filter(Data, OCCP %in% c(1:8))
Data$OCCP <- as.factor(Data$OCCP)

levels(Data$OCCP) <- c('MGR', 'CMM', 'FIN', 'LGL', 'MED' , 'BUS', 'ENG', 'SCI')
```

```{r, echo = FALSE}
#add in weights...example code from previous project:
#Example: How to calulate the mean and standard error of Income level using weights utilizing the "Survey" package

library(survey)
df1<-svrepdesign(variables=pus_new[,1:13], 
repweights=pus_new[,14:93], type="BRR",combined.weights=TRUE,
weights=pus_new$PWGTP)
summary(df1)
svymean(~ WAGP,df1, na.rm = T)

#If We only want to know the SE and Mean of Statistics Income?

pus_new$FOD1P[pus_new$FOD1P == 3702 | pus_new$FOD1P == 6212 | pus_new$FOD1P == 6202]<-"Statistics"
df<-subset(pus_new, pus_new$FOD1P=="Statistics")
df2<-svrepdesign(variables=df[,1:13], 
repweights=df[,14:93], type="BRR",combined.weights=TRUE,
weights=df$PWGTP)
summary(df2)
svymean(~ WAGP,df2, na.rm = T)
```
